page.title: 05Farming in Woodhalls
page.content: With the exception of a small area of arable land to the south-east the area is predominantly down to grassland.Only two farms now possess dairy herds and none keep any quantity of pigs or poultry.The farming is therefore narrowly based on beef,cattle and sheep. Most of the farms are small to medium in size,between 1OO and 2OO acres being the norm.The smaller farms are particularly vulnerable to being split up if sold.A 5O acre farm which was sold recently had some of its fields sold off separately to a neighbouring farmer.The price of land, even though little is suitable for cropping,can reach Â£18OO per acre. Future farming will probably remain dependent on beef and sheep, in spite of the dangers of over-production nationally.
